creator: sitongia@ucar.edu
text:
Seasons Greetings!

I start up Safari and can get to the root page of Tomcat through SSL, which I have enabled in the
server.xml.

I have a local Apache module which allows a secure login and maintains session state by puting a 
cookie in the browser.  It is a secure cookie that is digitally signed.

When my browser has that cookie, I can no longer connect to Tomcat through SSL.  If I manage the 
cookies and remove that one cookie, I can once again connect to Tomcat through SSL.  Throughout 
this, I can connect to Tomcat when I don't use SSL.

I can't find any debugging or logging information about what is happening.  It's like the browser no 
longer reaches Tomcat.

Safari says The error was: “bad server response” (NSURLErrorDomain:-1011).
Also cannot connect with Netscape 7.02.   It simply says the document contains no data.

I set the debugging level to 4 everywhere in server.xml and enabled the request dumper, but I still 
cannot see any sign that the request reaches Tomcat.

Thanks for your help.
==Leonard

creator: yoavs@computer.org
text:
If the request reached Tomcat, the RequestDumperValve would show its details.  
If the request doesn't reach Tomcat, it's not a Tomcat problem.  You might 
want to try the mailing lists to solicit advice on debugging further.
